text: Ron Miles (May 9, 1963 – March 8, 2022) was an American jazz trumpeter, cornetist, and composer. His career was based in Denver, Colorado. He was Denver's most well known jazz musicians. He was the co-ordinator of Jazz Studies at Metropolitan State University of Denver.Metropolitan State College of Denver – Department of Music Retrieved October 11, 2012. Miles died on March 8, 2022 at a hospital in Denver, Colorado from problems caused by polycythemia vera, a rare form of bone marrow cancer at the age of 58. ==References== Category:1963 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from bone marrow cancer Category:American composers Category:American jazz musicians Category:American trumpeters Category:Educators from Denver Category:Musicians from Indianapolis Category:Musicians from Denver
title: Ron Miles
